findings.rationale: The agreement allows either party to terminate with 30 days notice, which may lead to sudden loss of services or obligations.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate this Agreement with 30 days written notice for any reason.

findings.rationale: Limiting liability to fees paid in the preceding year may not cover potential damages, exposing parties to significant risk.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party's liability is limited to the total fees paid in the 12 months preceding the claim.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at annual fees may leave parties under-protected in case of significant breaches.
findings.evidence_quote: each party indemnifies the other for its own breach, capped at annual subscription fees.

findings.rationale: A confidentiality obligation of 18 months post-termination may not be sufficient for some sensitive information.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations continue for 18 months after termination.
